title: "mods have been removing my posts/censoring me!" usually means
body:
"I have been repeatedly putting my posts in the wrong board, I have named and shamed someone, or I am being so absurdly toxic that somehow the mods found it worthwhile to remove my posts." 

If people took the time to read the reason why their post was removed, this issue would never happen.

While I appreciate that not everyone agrees with our policies, and while I'm happy to take constructive, actionable criticism into account, I will point out that you DO agree to Board's policy on Riot's servers as part of both the Terms of Use and the board [**Universal Rules**](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/4LgZ2EwM-universal-rules). As they specifically say, "access to the Boards is a privilege, not a right."

We're always happy to explain or discuss policy, but "how about just not having policies" is not something we're interested in.

>...but I feel that I am often shunned and downvoted to hell by moderators who may even switch to non-mod accounts...

We definitely don't do that: it's time consuming enough to moderate the boards, and we don't stalk individual posters to downvote them, let alone from multiple accounts. If this were the case I'd frankly be ignoring you, rather than offering above to take constrictive critique from you.

But you don't have to believe me. Either way, I wish you the best. :)

Do note that if you have concerns about a specific moderator you can always come to the **Boards Discord** to share them. While I can't promise any specific action you might want will be taken, we do appreciate receiving feedback, and are happy to act on it if we feel action (such as additional training, for example) is appropriate.

Just please be as objective as possible if you do -- insults wouldn't be helpful, but raising concerns you've experienced with examples can be.

Not that you have to do this, but if you find yourself frustrated and want to the recourse is available. :)
